net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Interface StreamConI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConnectionI, MsgParsable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InetCon
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileCon, GroupClientCon, GroupServerCon, StreamCon, StreamConReader, TcpCon, TcpHandshakeCon

    public interface StreamConI
extends ConnectionI, MsgParsable
    An extension of ConnectionI, this interface outlines methods that could by useful for connections that are backed by streams.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    InputStream, OutputStream

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the connection, releasing any system resources.
      void flush()
      Flushes the connection's output buffer.
      boolean isClosed()
      Returns whether the connection has been closed.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.xuset.objectIO.connections.ConnectionI

        getId, isMsgAvailable, pollNextMsg, sendMsg

      • Methods inherited from interface net.xuset.objectIO.markupMsg.MsgParsable

        getParser, setParser

    • Method Detail

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether the connection has been closed.

        If the connection is closed, the connection should no longer be used. Be aware, this method can return true even though close() was never called.

        Returns:
        true if the connection is closed, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the connection, releasing any system resources. Once a connection has been closed, it should no longer be used.
        Since:
        1.0

      • flush

        void flush()
        Flushes the connection's output buffer. Not all connections buffer their outgoing messages so calling flush on some implementations will do nothing.
        Since:
        1.0
